title: The Framed Intern
setting: Sterling & Associates, law office, Friday 10 AM
premise: A vulgar email was sent from the intern's unattended computer to the entire firm at 12:35 PM Thursday. The intern swears he didn't send it and someone is trying to frame him.

suspects.name: Bridget Lawson
suspects.motive: The intern accidentally found and reported her billing irregularities to the partner
suspects.alibi: I was in a deposition across town at the Hartfield Building from 11 AM to 2 PM Thursday. The court reporter and opposing counsel can confirm I was there the entire time.

suspects.name: Jasper Thorne
suspects.motive: Jealous that the intern was being fast-tracked for a full-time offer over him
suspects.alibi: I was at my desk doing case research all afternoon Thursday. I ate lunch at my desk around 12:30 PM. My cubicle neighbor can confirm she saw me eating a sandwich.

suspects.name: Katherine Ng
suspects.motive: The intern complained about her attitude to management, leading to a written warning
suspects.alibi: I was at the front desk from 8 AM to 1 PM Thursday. A courier arrived at 12:30 PM and I signed for three packages. The courier's delivery log has my signature and timestamp.

suspects.name: Martin Hale
suspects.motive: Wants to demonstrate security vulnerabilities to justify his budget request for new software
suspects.alibi: I was at a cybersecurity seminar at the Grandview Conference Center from 10 AM to 3 PM Thursday. I have my badge and the printed program with my name in the attendee list.

clues.title: Intern's Location
clues.content: The intern confirms he stepped away from his unlocked computer at 12:25 PM to use the restroom. He returned at 12:40 PM and saw the sent email. His desk is in an open area near the paralegal cubicles.

clues.title: Email Header Analysis
clues.content: IT reviewed the email headers. The message was composed and sent directly from the intern's physical workstation, not remotely. It took approximately five minutes to type based on the draft timestamps.

clues.title: Conference Center Verification
clues.content: The Grandview Conference Center confirms the cybersecurity seminar was held on Wednesday, not Thursday. No events were scheduled at the center on Thursday at all.
